com.eyetechds.quicklink

Class QLDevice

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.eyetechds.quicklink.QLDevice

  • public class QLDevice
extends java.lang.Object
    A QLDevice object contains all the methods needed for communicating with and getting gaze data from a device

    Creating a QLDevice object
    A QLDevice object cannot be created directly. The only way to create an object and get its reference is by calling enumerate(Context). Only one object is created per device. If enumerate(Context) is called multiple time, the same reference will be returned each time. To completely destroy the QLDevice objects and create a new one the method cleanup() must be called before enumerate(Context) is called again.

    Modifying the device settings
    Under most circumstances the device can operate well without modifying any settings. To improve performance or customize operation the device settings can be modified by using the method importSettings(QLSettings).

    Getting gaze data
    To get gaze data from the device call the method getFrame(int). In order for the device to send gaze data a calibration must be applied by calling applyCalibration(QLCalibration) and the device must be started by calling start()

    See Also:
    QLSettings, QLCalibration

    • Method Detail

      • enumerate

        public static QLDevice[] enumerate(Context AppContext,
                   Handler deviceMessageHandler,
                   boolean statusRebroadcast)
        This method is the only way of getting a reference to a QLDevice object. The first time this method is called it detects the devices that are attached to the system and creates a new object for each one. Subsequent calls return the same references to the previously created objects. To force detection and object creation again, the method cleanup() must be called prior to re-calling this method.
        Parameters:
        AppContext - The context of the application.

        deviceMessageHandler - A message handler that will receive messages from the devices.

        statusRebroadcast - On the first call to this method this parameter is ignored. If this is true for subsequent calls then the current status of the devices will be broadcast to the device message handler.

        Returns:
        An array of QLDevice objects that are attached to the system.
        See Also:
        QLDeviceMessage, enumerate(Context), android#content#Context, android#os#Handler

      • enumerate

        public static QLDevice[] enumerate(Context AppContext)
        This method is the only way of getting a reference to a QLDevice object. The first time this method is called it detects the devices that are attached to the system and creates a new object for each one. Subsequent calls return the same references to the previously created objects. To force detection and object creation again, the method cleanup() must be called prior to re-calling this method.
        Parameters:
        AppContext - The context of the application.

        Returns:
        An array of QLDevice objects that are attached to the system.
        See Also:
        enumerate(Context, Handler, boolean), android#content#Context

      • cleanup

        public static void cleanup()
        This method is a way to force cleanup of all connection resources of device that were detected by calling enumerate(Context). It stops all devices, cleans up all threads and handles to the devices, and nulls out the device references.

        This method does not force garbage collection on internal resources, but it does make them available for garbage collection. All external hard references to devices should be destroyed prior to calling this method so that the device objects can become available for garbage collection.

        See Also:
        enumerate(Context)

      • applyCalibration

        public boolean applyCalibration(QLCalibration calibration)
        This method applies a calibration to a device. A calibration must be applied to a device before valid gaze data can be generated by the device. Once a calibration has been applied to a device it will stay with the device until it is power cycled or until another calibration has been applied.

        For greatest accuracy a device should be calibrated for each user and for each physical setup of the device and display.

        Parameters:
        calibration - A non-empty QLCalibration object to apply. The calibration object must be filled either by loading from a file by using QLCalibration.load(java.nio.channels.FileChannel) or by performing a calibration sequence.

        Returns:
        True if the calibration was successfully applied to the device. False if an error occurred. Call getLastError() to get further error information.
        See Also:
        QLCalibration

      • calibrateEyeRadius

        public boolean calibrateEyeRadius(double distance,
                         QLFloat leftRadius,
                         QLFloat rightRadius)
        This method uses the measured distance to the user in order to calculate the radius of the cornea for each eye. Using the radii returned by this function as the values for the settings QLSettings.DEVICE_IMAGE_PROCESSING_EYE_RADIUS_LEFT and QLSettings.DEVICE_IMAGE_PROCESSING_EYE_RADIUS_RIGHT will result in greater accuracy of the distance output for each frame.
        Parameters:
        distance - The actual measured distance in centimeters that the user is away from the device at the time this method is called.

        leftRadius - A QLFloat object that will receive the radius in centimeters of the cornea of the left eye.

        rightRadius - A QLFloat object that will receive the radius in centimeters of the cornea of the right eye.

        Returns:
        True if the method succeeded. False if there was an error. Call getLastError() to get further error information.
        See Also:
        QLFloat, QLSettings, QLSettings.DEVICE_IMAGE_PROCESSING_EYE_RADIUS_LEFT, QLSettings.DEVICE_IMAGE_PROCESSING_EYE_RADIUS_RIGHT

      • getInfo

        public QLDeviceInfo getInfo()
        This method gets device specific information from the device.
        Returns:
        If successful then a QLDeviceInfo object is returned that contains the device information. If there was an error then null is returned. Call getLastError() to get further error information.
        See Also:
        QLDeviceInfo

      • getStatus

        public QLDeviceStatus getStatus()
        This method gets the current status of the device.
        Returns:
        If successful then a QLDeviceStatus object is returned that contains the current device status. If there was an error then null is returned. Call getLastError() to get further error information.
        See Also:
        QLDeviceStatus

      • exportSettings

        public boolean exportSettings(QLSettings settings)
        This method exports the settings values that are currently being used by the device. The values are exported to the specified settings object. It will only export the values for setting that have been added to the settings object. To add a setting to the settings object use the method QLSettings.add(String settingName) or the method QLSettings.setValue(String name, String value).
        Parameters:
        settings - The settings object that will receive the exported values from the device.
        Returns:
        True if the method is successful. False if there was an error. Call getLastError() to get further error information.
        See Also:
        QLSettings

      • importSettings

        public boolean importSettings(QLSettings settings)
        This method imports settings values for the device from the specified settings object. This operation is synchronous with the device. The new settings values will take effect after the device has finished processing its current frame, resulting in a latency of one frame.
        Parameters:
        settings - The settings object that will supply the settings values that will be imported to the device.
        Returns:
        True if the method is successful. False if there was an error. Call getLastError() to get further error information.
        See Also:
        QLSettings

      • start

        public boolean start()
        This method causes the device to start running. Once running, the device will grab and process frames as fast as the current settings allow. Calling this method on a device that has already been started will not restart the device. stop() must be called before a device can be restarted.

        This method creates one or more threads. Do not call it from any other methods or threads that warn against creating threads from within them.

        Returns:
        True if the device was started successfully. False if there was an error. Call getLastError() to get further error information.

      • stop

        public boolean stop()
        This method causes the device to stop running. Before this class is unloaded, this method should be called for each device that has been started using start(). Undefined behavior could result if the class is unloaded before a device is stopped.

        This method kills one or more threads. Do not call it from any other methods or threads that warn against destroying threads from within them.

        Returns:
        True if the device was stopped successfully. False if there was an error. Call getLastError() to get further error information.
        See Also:
        stopAll()

      • stopAll

        public static void stopAll()
        This method causes all devices to stop running. Before unloading the class, each device that has been started by calling start() must be stopped. This can be done by calling stop() for each device that has been started, or this method could be called to stop all attached devices. Undefined behavior could result if the class is unloaded before a device is stopped.

        Call getLastError() to get error information.

        See Also:
        stop()

      • setIndicator

        public boolean setIndicator(QLIndicatorType indicatorType,
                   QLIndicatorMode indicatorMode,
                   QLColor color)
        This method sets the mode and color for the specified indicator.
        Parameters:
        indicatorType - A QLIndicatorType object that specifies which indicator to set.
        indicatorMode - A QLIndicatorMode object that specifies the indicator mode that should be used.
        color - A QLColor object that specifies the color of the indicator.
        Returns:
        True if the indicator was set successfully. False if there was an error. Call getLastError() to get further error information.
        See Also:
        getIndicator(QLIndicatorType, QLIndicatorMode, QLColor), QLIndicatorType, QLIndicatorMode, QLColor

      • getIndicator

        public boolean getIndicator(QLIndicatorType indicatorType,
                   QLIndicatorMode indicatorMode,
                   QLColor color)
        This method gets the current indicator mode and color for the specified indicator type.
        Parameters:
        indicatorType - A QLIndicatorType object that specifies which indicator to get.
        indicatorMode - A QLIndicatorMode object that receives the indicator mode that is being used.
        color - A QLColor object that receives the color of the indicator.
        Returns:
        True if the indicator was retrieved successfully. False if there was an error. Call getLastError() to get further error information.
        See Also:
        setIndicator(QLIndicatorType, QLIndicatorMode, QLColor), QLIndicatorType, QLIndicatorMode, QLColor

      • getFrame

        public QLFrameData getFrame(int waitTime)
        This method gets the most recent frame from the device. It is a blocking method which will wait for a frame to become available if there is not one ready. Waiting does not use CPU time.

        Only the most recent frame can be retrieved from the device. To ensure that no frames are dropped this function needs to be called at least as fast as the frame rate of the device. A good way to use this method that will minimize lost frames is to use it in a loop in its own thread. The blocking nature of this method will ensure that the loop will only run as fast as the device can produce frames. If other processing in the loop does not exceed the time that it takes for the device to make another frame available then this function will sync the loop to the approximate frame rate of the device.

        Parameters:
        waitTime - The maximum time in milliseconds to wait for a new frame.
        Returns:
        A new QLFrameData object that contains the data for the most recent frame. Null is returned if there is an error or if the timeout elapsed. Call getLastError() to get further error information.

      • getLastError

        public QLError getLastError()
        This method gets the last error that occurred for the device.
        Returns:
        The last error that occurred.
        See Also:
        QLError

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This method gets a string containing a concise, human-readable description of the device.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A printable representation of this device.

      • tryReconnect

        public void tryReconnect()
        This method cleans up all threads and handles for the device and then tries to reconnect * the device if possible.
